_comment: This data is an early work-in-progress and contains errors. Produced by @michaelh at Discuss and Discover SuttaCentral forum - please get in touch! Finished code forthcoming.

The similes used by Araka to describe th: Life as a human is like a drop of dew on a grass tip.
Life as a human is like a bubble.
Life as a human is like a line drawn in water.
Life as a human is like a mountain river.
Life as a human is like a glob of spit.
Life as a human is like a lump of meat.
Life as a human is like a cow being led to the slaughter.
The breakdown of a human life span in da: Living for 100 years or a little more
300 seasons, 100 each of winter, summer, and rains
1200 months, 400 in each of winter, summer, and rains
2400 fortnights, 800 in each of winter, summer, and rains
36,000 days, 12,000 in each of summer, winter, and rains
72,000 meals, 24,000 in each of summer, winter, and rains, including when you’re suckling at the breast, and when you’re prevented from eating
Things that prevent you from eating include anger, pain, sickness, sabbath, or being unable to get food.
